page.title: 01About Glenisla.
page.content: Glenisla is a beautiful Scottish glen in the Perthshire hills.It is thirty- two miles north-west of the city of Dundee.The countryside is mainly rough grassland and heather.The main job provider is farming.There are two hotels,a post office,a primary school and a church.The houses are widely scattered in this area and the population is small.There is a main B-class road running through the Glen. This is a through route to Glenshee and many skiers flock there in winter to the ski-slopes.There are two pony trekking centres one of which provides the opportunity for taking part in sailing, canoeing, grass skiing and cycling. The River Isla runs through the heart of the glen.
